commits.subject: filter baselined findings from scan results
commits.body:
MCP tools now filter out baselined findings and report them separately:

- Added BaselinedCount to ScanResult and PolicyCheckResult structs
- runScan() loads baseline and excludes baselined findings before
  truncation, ensuring only active findings are returned
- handlePolicyCheck() filters baselined findings when evaluating
  violations, allowing PASS when all findings are baselined
- Added loadBaseline() helper method for consistent baseline loading

This prevents AI assistants from repeatedly being shown already-accepted
findings, keeping responses focused on new issues that need attention.

Closes #7
commits.author: Felix Geelhaar

commits.subject: add configurable output limits for MCP server
commits.body:
Implements GitHub issue #6: MCP token/output limits.

Features:
- Add MCPConfig to schema with MaxFindings, MaxOutputBytes,
  and TruncateStrategy options
- Create TruncationService domain service for output limiting
- Support three strategies: priority (by severity), newest, oldest
- Preserve total finding counts while truncating returned list
- Add TruncationInfo to ScanResult for AI assistant context

Config options:
- max_findings: 50 (default), -1 to disable
- max_output_bytes: 50000 (default), -1 to disable
- truncate_strategy: priority|newest|oldest

The truncation service uses stable sort to maintain order within
same severity levels and provides detailed summary of hidden
findings by severity.
commits.author: Felix Geelhaar
